==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|空|蝉}}

===Etymology 1===
/utuso<sub>2</sub>mi<sub>1</sub>/ *[utusəmi] → /utusomi/. A contraction of {{m|ja|現し|tr=utsushi||reality}} and {{m|ja|臣|tr=omi<sub>1</sub>||subject, vassal}}. Older form of {{m|ja|空蝉|tr=utsusemi}}. The kanji are [[w:Ateji|ateji]].

====Pronunciation====
* {{IPA|[utsusomi]|lang=ja}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|うつそみ}}

# a living being
# the world of the living

=====Derived terms=====
* {{ja-r|空蝉|うつせみ}}

===Etymology 2===
/utusemi<sub>1</sub>/ → /utusemi/. From older /utusomi/. The association with a cicada shell is due to a reinterpretation based on the homonymous words {{m|ja|空|tr=utsu||hollow}} and {{m|ja|蝉|tr=semi||cicada}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{IPA|[utsusemi]|lang=ja}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|うつせみ}}

# a living being
# the world of the living
# the cast-off shell of a cicada
# emptiness
